greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Three-column table read by rows giving integer sides of proper triangles (i,j,k) with i >= j >= k >= 1, j+k > i.
link: Lars Blomberg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9000
example: Table begins (imprimitive triples are labeled i):
program: (PARI) for(i=1,6, for(j=1,i, for(k=1,j, if(j+k>i, print1(i,", ",j,", ",k,", "))))) \\ _Hugo Pfoertner_, Jan 25 2020
xref: There are A002620(k+1) rows that begin with k.
The three columns are A316843, A316844, A316845.
See A316851 and A316853 & A317182 for perimeter and area.
Other related sequences: A051493, A070080, A070081, A070082, A070110.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 23 2018, following a suggestion from _Donald S. McDonald_.
